abstract: Former Chilean intelligence officers Pedro Espinoza and Rafael Gonzalez are sentenced in 1973 murders of American citizens Frank Teruggi and Charles Horman; men had been detained in Chile for allegedly subversive activities, and ruling concludes that decision to kill them was result of a secret investigation of Americans' political activities in Chile by United States military, which passed information on to Chilean officials.
lead_paragraph: A ruling said the murders of two Americans were the result of a “secret investigation” of Americans’ political activities in Chile by the United States Military Group in Santiago.
snippet: A ruling said the murders of two Americans were the result of a “secret investigation” of Americans’ political activities in Chile by the United States Military Group in Santiago.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

headline.main: 2 Sentenced in Murders in Chile Coup
headline.print_headline: 2 Sentenced in Murders in Chile Coup
